00:00:04:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:04:140000.Dialogue: Non, c'est... Wo de ming zi shi Sheldon.

00:00:09:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:09:060000.Dialogue: Wo de ming zi shi Sheldon.

00:00:18:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:18:010000.Dialogue: I assumed, as in a number of languages, that the gesture was part of the phrase.

00:00:24:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:24:030000.Dialogue: How am I supposed to know that? As the teacher, it's your obligation to separate your personal idiosyncrasies from the subject matter.

00:00:30:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:30:200000.Dialogue: You know, I'm really glad you decided to learn Mandarin.

00:00:43:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:43:030000.Dialogue: You just called Leonard a syphilitic donkey.

00:00:47:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:47:060000.Dialogue: My apologies, I'm only as good as my teacher.

00:00:53:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:53:140000.Dialogue: I believe the Szechuan Palace has been passing off orange chicken as tangerine chicken and I intend to confront them.

00:01:00:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:00:210000.Dialogue: If I were you, I'd be more concerned about what they are passing off as chicken.

00:01:12:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:12:080000.Dialogue: Hey, jerk face, you forgot your iPod!

00:01:25:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:25:220000.Dialogue: Drop dead, you stupid self-centered bastard!

00:01:37:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:37:160000.Dialogue: Not now, I have a blog to find.

00:02:11:150000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:02:11:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:13:030000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:02:13:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:13:030000.Dialogue: I'm fine, Leonard. Just go away!

00:02:16:170000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:02:16:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:16:170000.Dialogue: I understand that breaking up with someone can be very painful...

00:02:19:180000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:02:19:180000.Speaker: Penny

00:02:27:220000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:02:27:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:30:210000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:02:30:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:30:210000.Dialogue: Not surprising. Penny's emotional response is originated in the primitive portion of the brain, known as the amygdala. While speech is centered in the much more recently developed neo-cortex. The former can easily overpower the latter, giving scientific credence to the notion of being rendered speechless.

00:02:50:230000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:02:50:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:50:230000.Dialogue: Or maybe she just doesn't want to talk.

00:02:55:220000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:02:55:220000.Speaker: Raj

00:03:01:130000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:01:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:01:130000.Dialogue: It's smashed beyond repair. What are you gonna do with it?

00:03:05:010000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:05:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:05:010000.Dialogue: What else? Sell it on eBay as slightly used.

00:03:08:220000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:08:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:08:220000.Dialogue: It was Penny's boyfriend's, they broke up.

00:03:10:230000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:10:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:10:230000.Dialogue: Apparently, he posted intimate details of their physical relationship on his blog which I cannot find anywhere.

00:03:19:030000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:19:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:19:030000.Dialogue: I'm gonna go back and try talking to her again.

00:03:21:230000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:21:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:21:230000.Dialogue: Good idea, sit with her. Hold her, comfort her. And if the moment feels right, see if you can cop a feel.

00:03:31:120000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:31:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:31:120000.Dialogue: I'm not going to do that, Howard.

00:03:33:060000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:33:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:33:060000.Dialogue: I'm not aware of a new social convention that requires you to intervene at all.

00:03:37:060000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:37:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:39:080000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:39:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:39:080000.Dialogue: Twelfth century code of chivalry? Not exactly current.

00:03:43:030000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:43:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:43:030000.Dialogue: You'd also have to be knighted for that to apply.

00:03:46:170000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:46:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:46:170000.Dialogue: I don't care. She's upset, I'm going over there.

00:03:49:070000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:49:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:49:070000.Dialogue: Remember to sit on your hands a bit, so they're warm.

00:03:53:140000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:53:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:53:140000.Dialogue: I'm her friend. I'm not going to take advantage of her vulnerability.

00:03:57:170000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:03:57:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:57:170000.Dialogue: So you're saying, if in the depths of despair, she throws herself at you and demands you take her, right there, right now, you'll just walk away?

00:04:05:230000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door and knocks.
00:04:05:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:05:230000.Dialogue: I said I'm her friend, not her gay friend.

00:04:13:130000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:13:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:13:130000.Dialogue: Listen, I know you said you didn't want to talk...

00:04:15:200000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:15:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:17:230000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:17:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:22:080000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:22:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:22:080000.Dialogue: Tell me the truth. Am I just an idiot who picks giant losers? So I pick good guys but turn them into losers.

00:04:32:150000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:32:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:42:170000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:42:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:42:170000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, what were the choices again?

00:04:45:090000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:45:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:45:090000.Dialogue: I really thought Mike was different. I thought he was... sensitive and smart, I mean, not you smart, normal non-freaky smart.

00:04:54:090000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:54:090000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:55:190000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:04:55:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:55:190000.Dialogue: And then he just goes and has to humiliate me by writing about me on his blog so the entire world can read it.

00:05:01:210000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:05:01:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:01:210000.Dialogue: I tell you, it's not all that easy to find.

00:05:04:170000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:05:04:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:04:170000.Dialogue: Really? My friends at work found it, my sister found it. Judging by my email, a number of prisoners at the Michigan State Penitentiary found it.

00:05:12:230000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:05:12:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:12:230000.Dialogue: What exactly did this guy write? Not that I need to know the details of your sex life. I just thought... Never mind.

00:05:21:150000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:05:21:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:21:150000.Dialogue: No, you know what? You might as well read it. Everybody else has. Go ahead. Oh, God, I just feel so betrayed and embarrassed! I just want to crawl into a hole and die!

00:05:36:210000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:05:36:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:36:210000.Dialogue: Okay. Well, you know, this isn't that bad. It just paints the picture of a very affectionate woman, who's open to expressing her affection in non-traditional locales.

00:05:48:170000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:05:48:170000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:50:150000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:05:50:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:56:150000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:05:56:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:56:150000.Dialogue: Out of curiosity, is this subway the transportation system or Subway the sandwich shop?

00:06:03:120000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:03:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:06:06:170000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:06:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:06:170000.Dialogue: Doesn't that violate the health code?

00:06:09:060000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:09:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:09:060000.Dialogue: No, at the sub shop we were only making out.

00:06:13:160000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:13:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:13:160000.Dialogue: But my point is that you have absolutely no reason to be embarrassed.

00:06:18:230000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:18:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:18:230000.Dialogue: Really? Do you think I overreacted?

00:06:21:160000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:21:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:21:160000.Dialogue: Because I do that. I do overreact. Maybe I should call Mike and apologize.

00:06:27:150000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:27:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:30:180000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:30:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:30:180000.Dialogue: He did break the implied confidentiality of the bedroom. And in your case, the elevator, parks and fast food franchise.

00:06:39:080000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:39:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:39:080000.Dialogue: You're right. I should just say I am done with him.

00:06:42:020000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:42:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:42:020000.Dialogue: Yes, you should. Go ahead, say it.

00:06:44:130000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:44:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:44:130000.Dialogue: But I never gave the man a chance to explain.

00:06:47:160000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:47:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:47:160000.Dialogue: What is there to explain? It's all right here. The betrayal!

00:06:52:150000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:06:52:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:52:150000.Dialogue: No, you were right the first time. This is a man who loves me, but in his own stupid way, which is trying to show people how he feels.

00:07:02:160000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:07:02:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:02:160000.Dialogue: I'm pretty sure I never said that.

00:07:06:060000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:07:06:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:06:060000.Dialogue: You did better than that. You helped me see it on my own.

00:07:09:020000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:07:09:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:12:070000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:07:12:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:13:140000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:07:13:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:13:140000.Dialogue: I'm going over to Mike's. Leonard, thank you so much.

00:07:16:060000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:07:16:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:24:080000.Scene: Penny’s flat. Penny is eating ice cream from the tub.
00:07:24:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:24:080000.Dialogue: Maybe I am her gay friend.

00:07:33:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:07:33:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:33:110000.Dialogue: I'm going to need another Mandarin lesson. I obviously didn't make my point with those people.

00:07:39:200000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:07:39:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:39:200000.Dialogue: For God's sake, if you don't like the tangerine chicken, don't order the tangerine chicken.

00:07:44:080000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:07:44:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:44:080000.Dialogue: I like tangerine chicken, I'm just not getting tangerine chicken.

00:07:49:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:07:49:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:49:090000.Dialogue: Can we please change the subject?

00:07:57:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:07:57:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:02:190000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:02:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:02:190000.Dialogue: Enslaved by warlocks. Stay here until you roll two, four or six.

00:08:06:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:06:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:08:210000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:08:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:08:210000.Dialogue: She was done with him! The relationship was broken beyond repair, and I walked over there, and I fixed it.

00:08:15:220000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:15:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:15:220000.Dialogue: Boy, that story gets better every time you hear it.

00:08:20:010000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:20:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:20:010000.Dialogue: Actually, I thought the first two renditions were far more compelling. Previously, I felt sympathy for the Leonard character, now I just find him to be whiny and annoying.

00:08:30:030000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:30:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:32:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:32:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:32:090000.Dialogue: I'd love to, but I don't have tangerine chicken.

00:08:37:170000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:37:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:37:170000.Dialogue: Thank you so much for your stupid advice!

00:08:46:170000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing a board game and eating Chinese food
00:08:46:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:46:170000.Dialogue: Incredible. You managed to screw up the screw-up.

00:08:58:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:58:230000.Dialogue: I'm sorry I yelled at you. It's not your fault.

00:09:05:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:05:120000.Dialogue: I went over to Mike's to make up with him.

00:09:07:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:07:160000.Dialogue: Yeah. No, I know that part.

00:09:10:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:10:080000.Dialogue: But he had already moved on.

00:09:14:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:14:050000.Dialogue: That's what I said to the woman who had her legs around his neck.

00:09:25:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:25:230000.Dialogue: You know, you did throw an 80-gig iPod... Yeah, no, how could he do that?

00:09:31:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:31:180000.Dialogue: I swear to God I am done with guys like that. You know, macho with the perfect body and the hair and the money.

00:09:39:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:39:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, that must get old quick.

00:09:42:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:42:070000.Dialogue: You know, just once I would like to go out with someone who is nice and honest and who actually cares about me.

00:09:58:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:58:150000.Dialogue: What about if you went out with me?

00:10:06:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:06:230000.Dialogue: Yes, I am... asking you out.

00:10:14:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:14:110000.Dialogue: I was just going off your comment about the nice guy.

00:10:25:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:25:000000.Dialogue: Yes, I will go out with you.

00:10:35:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:35:150000.Dialogue: Why not? I mean... What do I have to lose?

00:10:48:220000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:10:48:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:48:220000.Dialogue: Show me your citrus peels. Gay wo kan ni de jud zi pee.

00:10:56:010000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:10:56:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:56:010000.Dialogue: Show me your citrus peels. Gay wo kan ni de jud zi pee.

00:11:01:170000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:01:170000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:06:050000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:06:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:06:050000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. Look, do you have a second?

00:11:10:070000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:10:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:10:070000.Dialogue: A second what, pair of underwear?

00:11:13:070000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:13:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:13:070000.Dialogue: I was just wondering if I could talk to you. It's about Leonard.

00:11:16:180000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:16:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:16:180000.Dialogue: Why me? Why not Koothrappali or Wolowitz?

00:11:20:060000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:20:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:20:060000.Dialogue: Well, Raj can't talk to me unless he's drunk, and Wolowitz is, you know, disgusting.

00:11:26:230000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:26:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:30:110000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:30:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:30:110000.Dialogue: All I'm saying is, you know Leonard the best.

00:11:33:050000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:33:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:33:050000.Dialogue: Not necessarily. I'm often surprised by my lack of familiarity with Leonard. Just the other day I discovered he not only has a loofah, he hides it. Why do you suppose a man would be ashamed of having a loofah? I, myself, prefer to have my excess epithelial cells slough off naturally, but I don't condemn those who seek to accelerate the process.

00:11:53:060000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:11:53:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:53:060000.Dialogue: And until recently, I had no idea that despite his lactose intolerance, he can tolerate small amounts of non-fat ice cream without producing a noxious gas that I maintain, in the right concentration, could be weaponized.

00:12:06:180000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:06:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:06:180000.Dialogue: Leonard might come home. Can we talk in my apartment?

00:12:09:200000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:09:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:13:020000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:13:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:14:050000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:14:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:14:050000.Dialogue: Why not? We're already through the looking glass anyway.

00:12:21:230000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:21:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:21:230000.Dialogue: Okay, so here's the thing... I guess you're aware that Leonard asked me out.

00:12:27:150000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:27:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:27:150000.Dialogue: He didn't actually say anything, but when he came back to the apartment he was doing a dance that brought to mind the happy hippos in Fantasia.

00:12:36:100000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:36:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:36:100000.Dialogue: That's nice. Anyhow, the thing I wanted to talk to you about is, since Leonard and I have become friends... I was just... Wanna sit down?

00:12:46:020000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:46:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:46:020000.Dialogue: I wish it were that simple.

00:12:49:190000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:49:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:49:190000.Dialogue: I don't spend much time here, and so I've never really chosena place to sit.

00:12:54:050000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:54:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:55:190000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:55:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:55:190000.Dialogue: There are a number of options and...

00:12:59:020000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:12:59:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:59:020000.Dialogue: I'm really not familiar enough with the cushion densities, air flow patterns and dispersion of unlight to make an informed choice.

00:13:06:040000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:06:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:06:040000.Dialogue: Why don't you just pick one at random and if you don't like it you can sit somewhere else next time.

00:13:08:200000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:08:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:13:180000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:13:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:13:180000.Dialogue: You go ahead and talk while I figure it out.

00:13:20:040000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:20:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:20:040000.Dialogue: Here's the thing. So I've known for a while now that Leonard has had a little crush on me...

00:13:24:150000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:24:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:28:160000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:28:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:28:160000.Dialogue: I suppose so... in the same way Menelaus had a little crush on Helen of Troy.

00:13:34:160000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:34:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:34:160000.Dialogue: I don't really know who they are...

00:13:36:170000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:36:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:36:170000.Dialogue: Menelaus was the brother of Agamemnon.

00:13:40:030000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:40:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:40:030000.Dialogue: The point is, Leonard isn't the kind of guy I usually go out with.

00:13:44:180000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:44:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:44:180000.Dialogue: Leonard isn't the kind of guy anyone usually goes out with.

00:13:49:020000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:49:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:49:020000.Dialogue: Would you be open to rotating the couch clockwise 30 degrees?

00:13:52:040000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:52:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:54:090000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:13:54:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:54:090000.Dialogue: Leonard might be different in a good way. Obviously, my usual choices have not worked out so well.

00:14:00:060000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:00:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:00:060000.Dialogue: Your last one worked out well for Koothrappali. He got a free iPod.

00:14:06:170000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:06:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:08:150000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:08:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:08:150000.Dialogue: On the other hand, if things don't go well with Leonard, I risk losing a really good friend. I'm guessing he's not looking for a fling. He's the kind of guy that gets into a relationship for... like you would say, light years.

00:14:18:010000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:18:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:21:200000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:21:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:21:200000.Dialogue: No one would say that. A light year is a unit of distance not time.

00:14:25:190000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:25:190000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:34:200000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:34:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:37:000000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:37:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:37:000000.Dialogue: People hear the word year and they think duration. Foot-pound has the same problem, that's a unit of work, not of weight.

00:14:44:000000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:44:000000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:45:110000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:45:110000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:51:100000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:51:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:51:100000.Dialogue: I think this will be my seat.

00:14:54:160000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:54:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:54:160000.Dialogue: Do you have anything to say that has anything to do with what I'm talking about?

00:14:59:200000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:14:59:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:59:200000.Dialogue: Well, let's see... We might consider Schrodinger's cat.

00:15:04:210000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:04:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:04:210000.Dialogue: Schrodinger? Is that the woman in 2A?

00:15:07:110000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:07:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:07:110000.Dialogue: That's Mrs. Grossinger. She doesn't have a cat, she has a Mexican hairless. Annoying little animal.

00:15:11:090000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:11:090000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:15:070000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:15:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:15:070000.Dialogue: Sorry, you diverted me. Anyway, in 1935, Erwin Schrodinger, in an attempt to explain the Copenhagen interpretation of quantum physics, he proposed an experiment where a cat is placed in a box with a sealed vial of poison that will break open at a random time.

00:15:31:000000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:31:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:31:000000.Dialogue: Now, since no one knows when or if the poison has been released, until the box is opened, the cat can be thought of as both alive and dead.

00:15:45:180000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:45:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:45:180000.Dialogue: Sorry. I don't get the point.

00:15:47:100000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:47:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:47:100000.Dialogue: Of course you don't get it. I haven't made it yet.

00:15:51:090000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:51:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:51:090000.Dialogue: You'd have to be psychic to get it, and there's no such thing as psychic.

00:15:54:060000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:54:060000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:56:020000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:15:56:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:56:020000.Dialogue: Just like Schrodinger's cat, your potential relationship with Leonard right now can be thought of as both good and bad. It is only by opening the box that you'll find out which it is.

00:16:07:080000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:16:07:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:07:080000.Dialogue: Okay, so you're saying I should go out with Leonard.

00:16:13:180000.Scene: The lobby. Sheldon is listening to an iPod.
00:16:13:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:13:180000.Dialogue: Let me start again. In 1935, Erwin Schrodinger...

00:16:33:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:33:040000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I think I've made a mistake.  I can see that. Unless you're planning on running a marathon, choosing both stuffing and mashed potatoes is a starch-filled redundancy.

00:16:44:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:44:010000.Dialogue: A mistake involving Penny. You'll have to narrow it down.

00:16:50:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:50:010000.Dialogue: I don't think I can go out with her tonight.

00:16:54:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:54:060000.Dialogue: Other people would say Why not?

00:17:03:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:03:230000.Dialogue: Now that I'm actually about to go out with Penny, I'm not excited, I'm nauseous.

00:17:08:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:08:150000.Dialogue: Then your meal choice is appropriate. Starch absorbs fluid which reduces the amount of vomit available for violent expulsion.

00:17:16:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:16:190000.Dialogue: You also made a common grammatical mistake. You said nauseous, when you meant nauseated. But go on.

00:17:24:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:24:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon, this date is probably my one chance with Penny. What happens if I blow it?

00:17:29:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:29:120000.Dialogue: Well, if we accept your premise and also accept the highly improbable assumption that Penny is the only woman in the world for you, then we can logically conclude that the result of blowing it would be that you end up a lonely, bitter old man with no progeny. The image of any number of evil lighthouse keepers from Scooby-Doo cartoons comes to mind.

00:17:50:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:50:060000.Dialogue: What response on my part would bring this conversation to a speedy conclusion?

00:17:54:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:54:120000.Dialogue: Tell me whether or not to go through with the date.

00:18:28:140000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
00:18:28:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:28:140000.Dialogue: Thank you. You look very nice.

00:18:34:020000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
00:18:34:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:40:030000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
00:18:40:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:41:200000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
00:18:41:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:41:200000.Dialogue: Okay, yeah, great. Listen... Maybe we should talk first.

00:18:51:020000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
00:18:51:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:51:020000.Dialogue: But before you say anything, have you ever heard of Schrodinger's cat?

00:18:57:030000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
00:18:57:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:57:030000.Dialogue: Actually, I've heard far too much about Schrodinger's cat.

00:19:02:000000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
00:19:02:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:09:110000.Scene: Leonard approaches Penny’s door. He is wearing a suit. He knocks. Penny answers.
00:19:09:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:09:110000.Dialogue: All right, the cat's alive. Let's go to dinner.
